metadata.title: CVE-2015-8964 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The tty_set_termios_ldisc function in drivers/tty/tty_ldisc.c in the Linuxkernel before 4.5 allows local users to obtain sensitive information fromkernel memory by reading a tty data structure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8964` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-57-generic - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-lowlatency - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-57-generic - 4.4.0-57.78
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1038-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1038.45
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1042-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1042.46
No subscription required

linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10

linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-57.78').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1038.45').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1042.46').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
